Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Appendix:Variations of "kilo"

Translingual

[edit]
Kilo [1]
Kilo [2]
Kilo [3]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • kilo, KILO

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from English kilo.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ˈkilo][1]

Noun

[edit]

Kilo

  1. (international standards) NATO, ICAO, ITU & IMO radiotelephony clear code (spelling-alphabet name) for the letter K.
  2. (nautical) Signal flag for the letter K.
  3. (time zone) UTC+10:00


ICAO/NATO radiotelephonic clear codes
Alfa Bravo Charlie Delta Echo Foxtrot Golf Hotel India Juliett Kilo Lima Mike
November Oscar Papa Quebec Romeo Sierra Tango Uniform Victor Whiskey Xray Yankee Zulu
zero one two three (tree) four (fower) five (fife) six seven eight nine (niner) hundred thousand decimal

Translations

[edit]
the letter "K" in a national spelling alphabet
  • Bulgarian: Кило (Kilo)
  • Czech: Karel (cs)
  • English: King
  • Swedish: Kalle (sv)

References

[edit]
  1. ^ DIN 5009:2022-06, Deutsches Institut für Normung, June 2022, page Anhang B: Buchstabiertafel der ICAO („Radiotelephony Spelling Alphabet“)

Finnish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Possibly from Swedish *Kila äng, *Kilo äng, from Swedish kil (“wedge”).[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈkilo/, [ˈk̟ilo̞]
  • Rhymes: -ilo
  • Syllabification(key): Ki‧lo
  • Hyphenation(key): Ki‧lo

Proper noun

[edit]

Kilo

  1. a district of Espoo

Declension

[edit]

The internal locative cases (inessive, illative and elative) are used with this place name when referring to a location; for example, "in Kilo" is Kilossa.

Inflection of Kilo (Kotus type 1/valo, no gradation)

German

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Kilo n (strong, genitive Kilo, plural Kilos or Kilo)

  1. kilo

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Kilo [neuter, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein das Kilo die Kilos, Kilo
genitive eines des Kilo der Kilos, Kilo
dative einem dem Kilo den Kilos, Kilo
accusative ein das Kilo die Kilos, Kilo
